item.description:
In honor of the Presidents Day weekend, let's do an intermediate winter hike to summit Mt Pierce for a viewing of the Presidential range to the north.
This will be a classic clockwise loop up the Crawford Path (take a peek at Gibbs Falls) to the summit of Mt Pierce and down via the Webster Cliff trail and Mizpah Cutoff. We will meet at the parking area on Mt Clinton Road (just north of the AMC Highland Center @ Crawford Notch).

 

Overview:

What: Mount Pierce (4310')
Distance: 6.2 miles round trip
Elevation Gain: 2400'
Difficulty: Moderate
Pace: Moderate
Exposure: summit exposure
Book Time: 5.25 hours
Start Time: 10am

Route:
 
- Crawford Connector
- Crawford Path
- Webster Cliff Trail
- Mt Pierce summit
- Webster Cliff Trail
- Mizapah Cutoff
- Crawford Path
- Crawford Connector


Is this Hike for Me?

We will hike at a steady/brisk pace with short stops as necessary. Expect ice, deep snow and possible stream crossings. The trails are relatively sheltered however be prepared for extreme windchill conditions on and near the summit. Certain conditions may require us to alter our route.

We will start promptly at 10:00 AM so allow extra travel time to arrive early in order to prep your gear.

Please read the section on mandatory equipment below carefully!


To participate you should:

•Be comfortable hiking UPHILL at about 1.5 to 2.0 miles per hour at a 15% incline for about 4 miles.
•Be comfortable walking at least 8 miles on uneven terrain including ice and deep snow.
•Be able to carry pack weight for all the required gear. (1 liter of water alone weighs 2 pounds!)
•Be in good physical condition.
 
THIS IS NOT A HIKE FOR BEGINNERS.


Mandatory Equipment List:

•Katoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons or other full crampons
•Snowshoes
•Synthetic shirt and waterproof pants. No cotton! No jeans!
•Rain/Wind Jacket with hood. No Ponchos!
•Warm fleece layer.
•Warm gloves or preferably mittens. (2 pair is strongly recommended.)
•Warm fleece or wool hat.
•Balaclava
•Goggles(preferred) and/or Sunglasses 
•2 liters Water in wide-mouth bottles. No hydration systems!
•Headlamp
•Spare Lithium batteries for Headlamp. Bring Lithium, not Alkaline batteries.
•Trail Snacks suitable for freezing weather. (You don't want something that turns into a rock when frozen.)
•Lunch

•Boots - A pair of winter hiking boots is mandatory. You will be hiking in snow for many hours,
so you cannot get away with your summer hiking boots in January or February. You do NOT need plastic boots for general hiking anywhere in NH, but you WILL need waterproof winter boots comfort rated to at least -30 degrees. (No, we don't typically encounter those temperatures, but boots with that rating will keep you warm while you're having your lunch on snow or ice.)


Optional Gear:

•Hiking Poles - strongly recommended
•Gaiters
•Camera / Binoculars
•Toe warmers and hand warmers
•Ibuprofen
•Insulated Thermos (hot tea etc)


Carpool Option:
Use the comments to arrange any carpools. I will probably start very early Sat morning and stay over somewhere that night.
NOTE: keep in mind the holiday weekend may limit lodging availability. Plan accordingly.

Dinner:

We can hit Fabyan's Station on Route 302 for dinner after the hike.

Directions to Trailhead From Providence, RI:

Please allow 4 hours travel time from Providence

◦ Take Route 95 North
◦ Take Route 93 North to NH
◦ Take Exit 35 (Route 3 North) towards Twin Mountain
◦ Turn Right in Twin Mountain onto Route 302
◦ Mt Clinton Rd will be about ~8 miles on your left immediately before the AMC Highland Center
 

Trails and Other Info:

http://www.hikenewengland.com/PierceMizpah090410.html

http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Pierce

http://trailsnh.com/?find=Mt+Pierce


Contact Information

I will provide my cell phone number to all "YES" RSVPs the week of the hike. I encourage you to call me or email me if you have any questions about the hike or the gear required.


Liability Waiver:

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following:
this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to
participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary
knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the
Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself,
your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group
from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by
negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: Presidential Viewing From Mt Pierce
